get.description: Retrieve a list of bases associated with a specific workspace.

200.description: The request was successful, and a list of bases is returned.

500.description: The server encountered an unexpected error while processing the request.

post.description: Create a new base in a specified workspace. The request requires the workspace identifier in the path and base details in the request body.

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the workspace where the base will be created.

get.description: Retrieve meta details of a specific base using its unique identifier.

patch.description: Update properties of a specific base. You can modify fields such as the title and metadata of the base. The baseId parameter identifies the base to be updated, and the new details must be provided in the request body. At least one of title or meta must be provided.

delete.description: Delete a specific base using its unique identifier. Once deleted, the base and its associated data cannot be recovered.

get.description: Retrieve list of all tables within the specified base.

post.description: Create a new table within the specified base by providing the required table details in the request body.

get.description: Retrieve the details of a specific table.

patch.description: Update the details of a specific table.

post.description: Create a new field within the specified table.

patch.description: Update the details of a specific field.

parameters.name: fieldId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the field being updated.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all filters and groups for a specific view.

200.description: List of filters and groups retrieved successfully.

post.description: Create a new filter or filter-group for a specific view.

patch.description: Update the details of an existing filter or group.

parameters.name: filterId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the filter or group.

delete.description: Delete an existing filter or filter-group.

parameters.name: filterId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the filter or group.

put.description: Replace filters for a specific view. All the existing filters will be overwritten with the new filters specified in this request.

parameters.name: viewId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the view. It overwrites all existing filters.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all sorts for a specific view.

post.description: Create a new sort for a specific view.

patch.description: Update the details of an existing sort.

get.description: Retrieve a list of users associated with a specific base.

200.description: A list of users for the base.

post.description: Invite new users to a specific base using their email address.

patch.description: Update roles for existing users in a base.

delete.description: Remove users from a specific base using their IDs.

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful.

get.description:
This API endpoint allows you to retrieve records from a specified table. You can customize the response by applying various query parameters for filtering, sorting, and formatting.

**Pagination**: The response is paginated by default, with the first page being returned initially. The response includes the following additional information in the `pageInfo` JSON block:

- **next**: Contains the URL to retrieve the next page of records. For example, `"https://staging.noco.to/api/v3/tables/medhonywr18cysz/records?page=2"` points to the next page of records.
- If there are no more records available (you are on the last page), this attribute will be _null_.

The `pageInfo` attribute is particularly valuable when working with large datasets divided into multiple pages. It provides the necessary URL to seamlessly fetch subsequent pages, enabling efficient navigation through the dataset.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Allows you to specify the fields that you wish to include in your API response. By default, all the fields are included in the response.

Example: `fields=field1,field2` will include only 'field1' and 'field2' in the API response. 

Please note that it's essential not to include spaces between field names in the comma-separated list.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Allows you to specify the fields by which you want to sort the records in your API response. By default, sorting is done in ascending order for the designated fields. To sort in descending order, add a '-' symbol before the field name.

Example: `sort=field1,-field2` will sort the records first by 'field1' in ascending order and then by 'field2' in descending order.

If `viewId` query parameter is also included, the sort included here will take precedence over any sorting configuration defined in the view.

Please note that it's essential not to include spaces between field names in the comma-separated list.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description:
Enables you to define specific conditions for filtering records in your API response. Multiple conditions can be combined using logical operators such as 'and' and 'or'. Each condition consists of three parts: a field name, a comparison operator, and a value.

Example: `where=(field1,eq,value1)~and(field2,eq,value2)` will filter records where 'field1' is equal to 'value1' AND 'field2' is equal to 'value2'. 

You can also use other comparison operators like 'ne' (not equal), 'gt' (greater than), 'lt' (less than), and more, to create complex filtering rules.

If `viewId` query parameter is also included, then the filters included here will be applied over the filtering configuration defined in the view. 

Please remember to maintain the specified format, and do not include spaces between the different condition components

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
Enables you to control the pagination of your API response by specifying the page number you want to retrieve. By default, the first page is returned. If you want to retrieve the next page, you can increment the page number by one.

Example: `page=2` will return the second page of records in the dataset.

parameters.name: nestedPage
parameters.description:
Enables you to control the pagination of your nested data (linked records) in API response by specifying the page number you want to retrieve. By default, the first page is returned. If you want to retrieve the next page, you can increment the page number by one.

Example: `page=2` will return the second page of nested data records in the dataset.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Enables you to set a limit on the number of records you want to retrieve in your API response. By default, your response includes all the available records, but by using this parameter, you can control the quantity you receive.

Example: `limit=100` will constrain your response to the first 100 records in the dataset.

parameters.name: viewId
parameters.description:
***View Identifier***. Allows you to fetch records that are currently visible within a specific view. API retrieves records in the order they are displayed if the SORT option is enabled within that view.

Additionally, if you specify a `sort` query parameter, it will take precedence over any sorting configuration defined in the view. If you specify a `where` query parameter, it will be applied over the filtering configuration defined in the view. 

By default, all fields, including those that are disabled within the view, are included in the response. To explicitly specify which fields to include or exclude, you can use the `fields` query parameter to customize the output according to your requirements.

post.description:
This API endpoint allows the creation of new records within a specified table. Records to be inserted are input as an array of key-value pair objects, where each key corresponds to a field name. Ensure that all the required fields are included in the payload, with exceptions for fields designated as auto-increment or those having default values. 

Certain read-only field types will be disregarded if included in the request. These field types include Look Up, Roll Up, Formula, Created By, Updated By, Created At, Updated At, Button, Barcode and QR Code.

For **Attachment** field types, this API cannot be used. Instead, utilize the storage APIs for managing attachments. Support for attachment fields in the record update API will be added soon.

patch.description:
This API endpoint allows updating existing records within a specified table identified by an array of Record-IDs, serving as unique identifier for the record. Records to be updated are input as an array of key-value pair objects, where each key corresponds to a field name. Ensure that all the required fields are included in the payload, with exceptions for fields designated as auto-increment or those having default values.

Certain read-only field types will be disregarded if included in the request. These field types include Look Up, Roll Up, Formula, Created By, Updated By, Created At, Updated At, Button, Barcode and QR Code.

For **Link to another record** field type if specified, all the existing links will be removed & the one's specified in this payload will be inserted. 

For **Attachment** field types, this API cannot be used. Instead, utilize the storage APIs for managing attachments. Support for attachment fields in the record insert API will be added soon.

Note that a PATCH request only updates the specified fields while leaving other fields unaffected. Currently, PUT requests are not supported by this endpoint.

delete.description: This API endpoint allows deleting existing records within a specified table identified by an array of Record-IDs, serving as unique identifier for the record. Records to be deleted are input as an array of record-identifiers.

get.description: This API endpoint allows you to retrieve a single record identified by Record-ID, serving as unique identifier for the record from a specified table.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Allows you to specify the fields that you wish to include in your API response. By default, all the fields are included in the response.

Example: `fields=field1,field2` will include only 'field1' and 'field2' in the API response. 

Please note that it's essential not to include spaces between field names in the comma-separated list.

parameters.name: viewId
parameters.description: **View Identifier**. Allows you to fetch record count that are currently visible within a specific view.

get.description: This API endpoint allows you to retrieve the total number of records from a specified table or a view. You can narrow down search results by applying `where` query parameter

parameters.name: where
parameters.description:
Enables you to define specific conditions for filtering record count in your API response. Multiple conditions can be combined using logical operators such as 'and' and 'or'. Each condition consists of three parts: a field name, a comparison operator, and a value.

Example: `where=(field1,eq,value1)~and(field2,eq,value2)` will filter records where 'field1' is equal to 'value1' AND 'field2' is equal to 'value2'. 

You can also use other comparison operators like 'ne' (not equal), 'gt' (greater than), 'lt' (less than), and more, to create complex filtering rules.

If `viewId` query parameter is also included, then the filters included here will be applied over the filtering configuration defined in the view. 

Please remember to maintain the specified format, and do not include spaces between the different condition components

parameters.name: linkFieldId
parameters.description: **Links Field Identifier** corresponding to the relation field `Link to another record` established between tables.

get.description: This API endpoint allows you to retrieve list of linked records for a specific `Link to another record field` and `Record ID`. The response is an array of objects containing Primary Key and its corresponding display value.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: **Record Identifier** corresponding to the record in this table for which linked records are being fetched.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Allows you to specify the fields that you wish to include from the linked records in your API response. By default, only Primary Key and associated display value field is included.

Example: `fields=field1,field2` will include only 'field1' and 'field2' in the API response. 

Please note that it's essential not to include spaces between field names in the comma-separated list.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Allows you to specify the fields by which you want to sort linked records in your API response. By default, sorting is done in ascending order for the designated fields. To sort in descending order, add a '-' symbol before the field name.

Example: `sort=field1,-field2` will sort the records first by 'field1' in ascending order and then by 'field2' in descending order.

Please note that it's essential not to include spaces between field names in the comma-separated list.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description:
Enables you to define specific conditions for filtering linked records in your API response. Multiple conditions can be combined using logical operators such as 'and' and 'or'. Each condition consists of three parts: a field name, a comparison operator, and a value.

Example: `where=(field1,eq,value1)~and(field2,eq,value2)` will filter linked records where 'field1' is equal to 'value1' AND 'field2' is equal to 'value2'. 

You can also use other comparison operators like 'ne' (not equal), 'gt' (greater than), 'lt' (less than), and more, to create complex filtering rules.

Please remember to maintain the specified format, and do not include spaces between the different condition components

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
Enables you to control the pagination of your API response by specifying the page number you want to retrieve. By default, the first page is returned. If you want to retrieve the next page, you can increment the page number by one.

Example: `page=2` will return the second page of linked records in the dataset.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Enables you to set a limit on the number of linked records you want to retrieve in your API response. By default, your response includes all the available linked records, but by using this parameter, you can control the quantity you receive.

Example: `limit=100` will constrain your response to the first 100 linked records in the dataset.

post.description: This API endpoint allows you to link records to a specific `Link field` and `Record ID`. The request payload is an array of record-ids from the adjacent table for linking purposes. Note that any existing links, if present, will be unaffected during this operation.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: **Record Identifier** corresponding to the record in this table for which links are being created.

delete.description:
This API endpoint allows you to unlink records from a specific `Link field` and `Record ID`. The request payload is an array of record-ids from the adjacent table for unlinking purposes. Note that, 
- duplicated record-ids will be ignored.
- non-existent record-ids will be ignored.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: **Record Identifier** corresponding to the record in this table for which links are being removed.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the base was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the base was last updated.

workspace_id.description: Unique identifier for the workspace to which this base belongs to.

id.description: Unique identifier for the data source.

type.description: Type of the data source (e.g., pg, mysql).

is_schema_readonly.description: Indicates if the schema in this data source is read-only.

is_data_readonly.description: Indicates if the data (records) in this data source is read-only.

integration_id.description: Integration ID for the data source.

sources.description: List of data sources associated with this base. This information will be included only if one or more external data sources are associated with the base.

icon_color.description: Specifies the color of the base icon using a hexadecimal color code (e.g., `#36BFFF`)

Specifies the color of the base icon using a hexadecimal color code (e.g., `#36BFFF`).

**Constraints**:
- Must be a valid 6-character hexadecimal color code preceded by a `#`.
- Optional field; defaults to a standard color if not provided.

base_id.description: Unique identifier for the base to which this table belongs to.

source_id.description: Unique identifier for the data source. This information will be included only if the table is associated with an external data source.

workspace_id.description: Unique identifier for the workspace to which this base belongs to.

icon.description: Icon prefix to the table name that needs to be displayed in-lieu of the default table icon.

source_id.description: Unique identifier for the data source. Include this information only if the table being created is part of a data source.

default_value.description: Default value for the field. Applicable for SingleLineText, LongText, PhoneNumber, URL, Email, Number, Decimal, Currency, Percent, Duration, Date, DateTime, Time, SingleSelect, MultiSelect, Rating, Checkbox, User and JSON fields.

source_id.description: Unique identifier for the data source. This information will be included only if the table is associated with an external data source.

base_id.description: Unique identifier for the base to which this table belongs to.

display_field_id.description: Unique identifier for the display field of the table. First non system field is set as display field by default.

workspace_id.description: Unique identifier for the workspace to which this base belongs to.

fields.description: List of fields associated with this table.

views.description: List of views associated with this table.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the user was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the user access was last updated.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user. Can be provided optionally during creation.

email.description: Email address of the user. Used as a primary identifier if 'id' is not provided.

items.description: An object representing a new user to be created.

BaseUserCreate.description: Array of users to be created.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user. Used as a primary identifier if provided.

email.description: Email address of the user. Used as a primary identifier if 'id' is not provided.

items.description: An object representing updates for an existing user.

icon.description: Icon prefix to the table name that needs to be displayed in-lieu of the default table icon.

display_field_id.description: Unique identifier for the display field of the table. The type of the field should be one of the allowed types for display field.

meta.description: Icon prefix to the table name that needs to be displayed in-lieu of the default table icon.

field_id.description: Identifier for the field being sorted.
Identifier for the field being sorted.
Identifier for the field being sorted.

is_default.description: Indicates if this is the default view.

locked_by_user_id.description: User ID of the person who locked the view.

is_hidden.description: Indicates if the field is hidden in GRID view.

field_id.description: Field ID for grouping in GRID view.
Field ID displayed in GALLERY view.

cover_image.description: Indicates if the field is the cover image.

cover_image_field_id.description: Field ID for the cover image.

field_id.description: Field ID used in KANBAN view.

is_stack_by.description: Indicates if the field is used for stacking in KANBAN.

cover_image_field_id.description: Field ID for the cover image.

kanban_stack_by_field_id.description: Field ID used for stacking in KANBAN view.

field_id.description: Field ID displayed in CALENDAR view.

is_date_field.description: Indicates if the field is used for date ranges.

start_field_id.description: Field ID for the start date.

end_field_id.description: Field ID for the end date.

field_id.description: Field ID used in FORM view.

is_required.description: Indicates if the field is required in the form.

form_success_message.description: Success message shown after form submission.

form_redirect_url.description: URL to redirect to after form submission.

form_send_response_email.description: Whether to send a response email.

form_show_another.description: Whether to show another form after submission.

form_show_blank.description: Whether to show a blank form after submission.

form_hide_banner.description: Whether to hide the banner on the form.

form_hide_branding.description: Whether to hide branding on the form.

form_banner_image_url.description: URL of the banner image for the form.

form_logo_url.description: URL of the logo for the form.

default_value.description: Default value for the field. Applicable for SingleLineText, LongText, PhoneNumber, URL, Email, Number, Decimal, Currency, Percent, Duration, Date, DateTime, Time, SingleSelect, MultiSelect, Rating, Checkbox, User and JSON fields.

generate_text_using_ai.description: Enable text generation for this field using NocoAI.

locale_string.description: Show thousand separator on the UI.

FieldOptions_Currency.description: Currency settings for this column. Locale defaults to `en-US` and currency code defaults to `USD`

locale.description: Locale for currency formatting. Refer https://simplelocalize.io/data/locales/

format.description:
Duration format. Supported options are listed below
- `h:mm`
- `h:mm:ss`
- `h:mm:ss.S`
- `h:mm:ss.SS`
- `h:mm:ss.SSS`

date_format.description:
Date format. Supported options are listed below
- `YYYY/MM/DD`
- `YYYY-MM-DD`
- `YYYY MM DD`
- `DD/MM/YYYY`
- `DD-MM-YYYY`
- `DD MM YYYY`
- `MM/DD/YYYY`
- `MM-DD-YYYY`
- `MM DD YYYY`
- `YYYY-MM`
- `YYYY MM`

time_format.description:
Time format. Supported options are listed below
- `HH:mm`
- `HH:mm:ss`
- `HH:mm:ss.SSS`

Icon to display rating on the UI. Supported options are listed below

- `circle-filled`

value_field_id.description: Field ID that contains the value.

link_field_id.description: Linked field ID. Can be of type Links or LinkToAnotherRecord

linked_table_lookup_field_id.description: Lookup field ID in the linked table.

linked_table_rollup_field_id.description: Rollup field ID in the linked table.

relation_type.description:
Type of relationship.

Supported options are listed below
- `mm` many-to-many
- `hm` has-many
- `oo` one-to-one

parent_id.description: Parent ID of the filter, specifying this filters group association.

field_id.description: Field ID to which this filter applies. Defaults to **root**.

operator.description: Primary comparison operator (e.g., eq, gt, lt).

list.description: List of filter groups. Initial set of filters are mapped to a default group with group-id set to **root**.

filters.description: List of filters in this group.
List of filters or nested filter groups at level 3.
List of filters or nested filter groups at level 2.

group_operator.description: Logical operator for combining filters in the group.

nestedNext.description: URL to access current page data with next set of nested fields data

nestedPrev.description: URL to access current page data with previous set of nested fields data

xc-token.name: Auth Token
xc-token.description: Auth Token is a JWT Token generated based on the logged-in user. By default, the token is only valid for 10 hours. However, you can change the value by defining it using environment variable `NC_JWT_EXPIRES_IN`.

xc-token.name: xc-token
xc-token.description: API Token. Refer [here](https://docs.nocodb.com/account-settings/api-tokens/) to know more
